intro: Razoumofskya caucasica, commonly known as Caucasian razoumofskya, is a flowering plant native to the Caucasus region. It is a member of the Geraniaceae family and is characterized by its striking, palmate leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in sunny, well-drained environments. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and is often cultivated in gardens for its unique foliage and floral display. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and somewhat challenging plant to grow outside its native range.
